page.title: 07MUSEUMS OF CHRISTCHURCH
page.content: THERE ARE TWO MUSEUMS IN CHRISTCHURCH, THE RED HOUSE MUSEUM AND THE TRICYCLE MUSEUM WHICH ARE BOTH SITUATED NEAR THE QUAY. THE RED HOUSE CONTAINS MANY ITEMS OF LOCAL INTEREST, PARTICULARLY RELATING TO THE EARLY HISTORY OF A LOCAL PROMONTORY CALLED HENGISTBURY HEAD, WHICH WAS AN IMPORTANT IRON-AGE PORT. THE MUSEUM ALSO HAS AN INTERESTING NATURAL HISTORY COLLECTION, A DISPLAY OF OLD COSTUMES AND A RESTFUL GARDEN WITH A FISHPOND. THE TRICYCLE MUSEUM, WHICH OPENED IN 1984, CONTAINS UNICYCLES, BICYCLES AND TRICYCLES OF VARIOUS AGES. IN MILLHAMS STREET THERE IS A GALLERY AND WORKSHOP WHERE LOCAL ARTISTS AND CRAFTSMEN DISPLAY THEIR WORK. THE REGENT CENTRE, A FORMER BINGO HALL, IS USED FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS.
